properties.areaDesc: Southern Centre; Blair; Clearfield; Northern Centre; Cambria
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 10:37PM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of 20 MPH which can
rapidly reduce visibility to less than one half mile.

LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1036 PM EST, a snow squall was along a
line extending from near Clearfield to near McMurray and moving east
at 30 MPH.

THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR...
Clearfield, Plymptonville and Hyde around 1040 PM EST.
Woodland and Lecontes Mills around 1045 PM EST.
North Philipsburg, Philipsburg and Chester Hill around 1100 PM
EST.
Black Moshannon State Park and Moshannon around 1115 PM EST.
Port Matilda around 1120 PM EST.
Stormstown around 1125 PM EST.

For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the
Penfield and Lamar exits, specifically from mile markers 119 to 167.

This includes Interstate 99 between mile markers 45 and 69...and from
mile markers 84 to 85.

SAFETY INFO...
Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall.
Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely.
Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN CENTRE...CLEARFIELD... BLAIR...CAMBRIA...AND SOUTHERN CENTRE COUNTIES
